definition: surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Never to master one's anger is a mark of intemperance and lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 不能剋制怒氣是任性和缺乏教養的標誌。

sentences.english: But I like the arrogant, imperious, imposing, self-willed I.
sentences.chinese: 不過我喜歡高傲，專橫，威風，任性的自己。

sentences.english: In the class that day was an obstreperous man who was creating turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 那天教室裏有個任性的男人在搗亂。

sentences.english: Some time I don't know why I will cry, just letting tears down capriciously.
sentences.chinese: 很多時候不懂得爲何會流淚，只是肆意得任性得流下。

sentences.english: The man is SO headstrong that always determines to have his own way.
sentences.chinese: 那個男人頑固任性，經常固執已見地決定自行其事。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, I would like to say sorry to you for my self-willed behavior.
sentences.chinese: 同時，我想爲我任性的行爲對你說聲對不起。
親愛的，忘記我的任性，好嗎？

sentences.english: They will keep you from the adulteress , from the wayward wife with her seductive words .
sentences.chinese: 他們將隨時向你從奸，從任性的妻子與她的誘人字眼。

sentences.english: Sometimes I think I'm a bad girl, capricious, adamant, and bilious .
sentences.chinese: 有時我覺得我是壞的女孩，任性，堅決，和膽汁。

sentences.english: The boy is wayward, but he'll knuckl down under discipline.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩任性得很，不過用紀律約束他會服服帖帖的。

sentences.english: Hi, I'm the owner who is a thinking-too-much, capricious, and lazy cat of the vendor in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 我是森林小喫攤的老闆，一隻想太多又很任性的懶貓。

sentences.english: I be so capricious, you don't love.
sentences.chinese: 我就是這樣任性，邇愛要不要。

sentences.english: Since that willfulness travel, I never taught over.
sentences.chinese: 自從那次任性的旅行後，我再也沒有遠行過。

sentences.english: The reluctance to go home was not confined to wayward men.
sentences.chinese: 捨不得回家的並不限於任性的男客。

sentences.english: "He likes to have his own way very well, " replied Colonel Fitzwilliam.
sentences.chinese: “他太任性了，”費茨威廉上校回答道。

definition: see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to continue in one's own way (idiom)
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
